Geesthacht: New flower bed signs encourage replanting
Franko Stein (FD Environment, left) and Friedhelm Ringe (Nabu)
set up plant signs in the flower beds of the pedestrian zone.
The campaign "Geesthacht in bloom" also includes information about what is currently blooming currently in the colors white and pink.
Geesthacht.
"Geesthacht in Bloom" is an initiative by Nabu in cooperation with the city administration.
With the participation of many volunteers from clubs, schools, daycare centers, companies, and institutions, thousands of flower bulbs and plants have been planted since 2015.
The goal: to create extensive flowering islands in the Geesthacht urban area where insects can find food at any time.
"With favorable weather conditions, bees already fly out in January to search for food," says Friedhelm Ringe from Geesthacht Nabu.
He himself has beehives on his property.

To ensure that the project is not just an initiative of conservationists and the city's environmental department, but also extends into private gardens, explanatory panels about the plants are regularly provided.
About 50 signs have been placed so far.
Passers-by can thus inform themselves about what is currently blooming so beautifully.
The hope is that hobby gardeners will deliberately plant these at home.
In the first week of January, the Wildhasel season had already started
More recent additions to the pedestrian zone's flower beds include shrubs such as winter fragrant cherry laurel and winter snowball.

They have been planted in the containers along Bergedorfer Street for a year now, showing their first delicate white and pink blossoms without leaves, and have recently been provided with additional signs.
"The winter fragrant cherry laurel is a very wide bush and can grow between two meters high and three meters wide," can be read there, along with other information about the suitable location.
Friedhelm Ringe emphasizes that not only the bed plants are now showing flowers.
The wild hazel season started in the first week of January.
It blooms particularly lushly on Richtweg near the slope, in Gutenbergstraße, Wilhelm-Holert-Straße, Fahrendofer Weg, and many hedgerows.
Ernestine is 102 years old:
"Stepping keeps me young"
Munich Dance legend
Fred Astaire would surely be proud of them if he looked down from heaven to Munich's East Train Station!
Every Monday, three ladies meet at the "Mandolin Motion Show Academy" at exactly 3 pm for a lively tap dance together they are an incredible 277 years old, or rather young!
The oldest of them is Ernestine Stauchner, who recently celebrated her 102nd birthday.
For the native Munich woman (born January 15, 1921) from Schwanthaler Höh, Monday is THE highlight of the week.
"Dancing and tap dancing is my life, I can't imagine it without them.
With Ernestine, Eva-Maria Stolze (almost 97) and Elfriede Widmann (79) also hit the dance floor.
The 97-year-old was born in 1926 in Jena (Thuringia).
She was a soubrette, today one would say a musical actress, and worked with the legendary Marika Rökk.
"I spent my life dancing, acting, and singing.
At 79 years old, Elfriede Widmann is something like the youngest in the group of tap dancers.
She says, "We just have fun here with our dance teacher Sissy Engl.
Wikipedia:
Tap dance was developed in the 19th century in the USA and is now known all over the world.

With two metal plates, which are more durable than the initially used wooden soles, attached to the front and back of the shoes, rhythmic sounds are produced while dancing, which match the visual impression and the music.
The dancer thus becomes a percussion musician.
The English expression for this is onomatopoeically Tap dance and the French Claquettes.
The Spanish Flamenco may have influenced tap dance.
The tips of the shoes are nailed so that they produce a clearly audible sound when dancing.
The 77-year-old Sissi Engl is the heart and soul of the dance studio at Ostbahnhof.
She is an actress, dancer, and choreographer.
"We are a big family, and everyone is welcome here, young and old, big and small.
And what is the recipe for such a long life?
"Movement keeps me young," the 102-year-old tells BILD.
Her advice to everyone: "Exercise, healthy eating, and no alcohol.

Deutsche Bank CEO Christian Sewing considers further interest rate hikes in the fight against high inflation rates to be "absolutely" necessary.
"The inflationary risks remain high.
Energy costs can easily rise again, and the opening of China can temporarily boost prices," Sewing told "Welt am Sonntag.
The European Central Bank (ECB) raised interest rates in the euro area for the fifth consecutive time in early February and indicated a further increase of another 0.
5 percentage points for the meeting on March 16.
The prime rate in the euro area is now at 3. 0 percent.
The deposit rate, which commercial banks receive when they park money at the ECB, is 2. 5 percent.
Higher interest rates make loans more expensive.
This can slow down demand and counteract high inflation rates.
At the same time, higher loan interest rates can lead to postponed investments and thus weaker economic growth.
Rising interest rates are also a burden for highly indebted eurozone countries like Italy.
"The consequences of persistently high inflation are much more severe than higher financing costs for some countries," said Sewing.
"Of course, we must keep an eye on this, but high levels of debt should not prevent the ECB from acting consistently. "
The ECB aims for medium-term price stability in the euro area with an inflation rate of two percent.
This target has been far off for months.
In January, the price increase weakened again, but consumer prices in the currency area of the now 20 countries were still 8.
5 percent above the level of the previous year's month.
Higher inflation rates reduce the purchasing power of consumers, as they can afford less for one euro.
Significantly increased energy prices, which are a major driver of inflation, are also a burden for companies.
If inflation remains high, private consumption will "collapse sooner or later," warned Sewing, who is also President of the Federal Association of German Banks (BdB).
"I currently see this as the greatest danger to the German economy.
But I am optimistic that we can avoid this scenario.

Union warns against the breakup of the Bayer Group
The chemical union IG BCE warns of a potential breakup of the Bayer corporation following an announced leadership change.

"From the perspective of the employees, Bayer is perfectly positioned with its three pillars to face the challenges of the future," said Francesco Grioli, board member of the union and Bayer supervisory board, in the "Rheinische Post" (Saturday edition).
The reference is to the pharmaceutical business with prescription drugs, the Consumer Health sector with over-the-counter medications, and the agricultural business.
"The transformation of the industry can only be managed with a corporate policy based on risk diversification and sustainability not on hedge fund activism.
The background is the announced change of leadership at the pharmaceutical and agrochemical company on Thursday.
The controversial CEO Werner Baumann will step down from his position this summer.
Bill Anderson, the former pharmaceutical head of Swiss rival Roche, is set to take over in early June.
Baumann has long been under criticism.
The 2018 acquisition of US seed producer Monsanto for $63 billion continues to haunt the manager.
With the purchase, the Leverkusen-based company brought expensive legal disputes over alleged cancer risks of the weed killer glyphosate into their house.
The Bayer stock has been in decline for years.
In 2019, shareholders even refused to relieve the CEO at the annual general meeting.
It has been known for some time that Baumann does not intend to extend his contract, which was originally supposed to run until 2024.
Long-term strategic investors had been putting pressure on him.
Recently, several activist Anglo-Saxon investors, such as Bluebell Capital, have also been involved.
According to a media report, Bluebell is pushing for a breakup of the corporation.
The very small fund with an unknown stake in Bayer is known for its aggressive approach.
"A spin-off of the Consumer Health division could be a possible way to increase the company's value," said Markus Manns, fund manager at Union Investment, in an interview with the "Rheinische Post".
However, he does not consider a spin-off of the much larger Crop Science agricultural division to be feasible.
Hundreds of thousands want to protest against pension reform
Paris
On Saturday, the French also plan to take to the streets again to protest the proposed pension reform.
Trade unions are opposing a government project with massive street protests.
Hundreds of thousands are expected to demonstrate against pension reform again on Saturday.
In France, hundreds of thousands of people are expected to take to the streets again on Saturday to protest against President Emmanuel Macron's planned pension reform.
For the fourth time, unions are mobilizing against the government's plans to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 years.
Twice already, over a million people have taken to the streets and there have been nationwide strikes.
Last Tuesday, 750,000 participants were counted at protests.
A turbulent debate has been taking place in parliament for a week over the controversial reform.
Already, many people in France work longer than the age of 62 if they have not contributed long enough for a full pension when they reach the retirement age.
Opponents of the reform argue that people in many demanding jobs can hardly work any longer.
Moreover, employees want to be able to enjoy their well-deserved pension and not completely wear out their health in their job.
Macron: Looming Deficit in Pension Fund
Macron justifies the reform with a looming deficit in the pension fund.
As the population gets older, employees must cover an increasing number of retirees with their contributions.
In order to maintain the level of pensions, the population must work a little more.
Critics question the government's calculations and demand that the state find other sources of money to keep the pension system in balance.
However, the government does not only want to adjust the retirement age.
The already decided increase in the necessary contribution period for a full pension is to be accelerated.
In addition, individual pension systems with privileges for certain professional groups are to be abolished.
The minimum pension is expected to rise to around 1200 Euros.
The pension reform is considered one of President Macron's most important projects.
During the Corona pandemic, an initial attempt to implement the reform was abandoned, with massive protests and strikes already taking place at that time.
Several presidents before Macron have tried with varying success to reform the French pension system widespread protests and strikes were a certainty for all of them.
Since Macron's camp no longer has an absolute majority in parliament, they hope to push through the reform with the help of the conservative Républicains, who have announced their support.
However, some of the deputies even from Macron's faction still have reservations.
And currently, Macron's concern about crippling strikes may be greater than the fear of a close vote.

Before the renewed demonstrations on Saturday, the president said that he could count on the organizers' sense of responsibility to ensure that they proceeded calmly and did not lead to a blockade of the country.
Calm weather expected lots of sunshine at high altitudes
A powerful high-pressure system is located over Central Europe and determines the weather in Germany.
Does this mean that we can expect a lot of sunshine everywhere?
Offenbach
In Germany, calm high-pressure weather is expected at least until the middle of the week.

"When looking at the weather maps, a powerful high-pressure area directly over Central Europe immediately catches the eye," explains meteorologist Markus Übel from the German Weather Service on Saturday in Offenbach.
"Although this high-pressure area shifts a little to the east during the course of next week, it continues to determine the weather in Germany.
However, calm high-pressure weather in winter does not necessarily mean sunny weather, says Übel.
"Such a high can even be quite mean and bring people in the lowlands days of dreary high fog gray, while there is pure sunshine in the high altitudes of the low mountain ranges.
The Sunday starts foggy and overcast in most regions.
According to DWD, there may still be some rain from the Ore Mountains and the Thuringian Forest to Lower Bavaria.
The cloud cover will loosen up mainly at the edge of the Alps, but also in the southwest and partly in the west during the day, and the sun will appear more frequently.
In the rest of the country, it remains heavily cloudy or covered with high fog.
Temperatures will reach 4 to 9 degrees, around 10 degrees near the Rhine.
"On Monday, the gradually strengthening sun will nibble at the high fog and dissolve it more and more throughout the day," says the meteorologist.

All-day sunshine is expected at the edge of the Alps, in the high altitudes of the low mountain ranges, and in parts of North Rhine-Westphalia, while elsewhere it has to fight its way through the high fog cover.
The maximum temperatures are between 5 and 9 degrees, around 11 degrees at the Lower Rhine, but only around 3 degrees are expected in the persistent gray in the southeast.
A weak wind blows from different directions.
On Tuesday, in some low-lying areas, there may be slow dissipation of fog or high fog again.
Otherwise, the weather will be sunny after the fog clears.
In high altitudes, in large parts of NRW, and at the edge of the Alps, the sun is expected to shine all day long.
Temperatures will climb to 5 to 11 degrees Celsius, depending on the sunshine.

Zelensky and ministers oppose
Russia's Olympic participation
Kyiv.

With the demand to exclude Russian and Belarusian athletes from the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris, sports politicians from 35 nations have increased pressure on the International Olympic Committee (IOC).

It was agreed in a joint teleconference to draft a statement to prevent attempts to send athletes from Russia and Belarus back to international sports competitions, according to the Lithuanian Ministry of Sports on its website.

"We demand the exclusion of Russian and Belarusian athletes from all international competitions, including the Olympic Games, as long as the war in Ukraine continues," said Minister Jurgita Šiugždinienė.
The video consultation took place at the initiative of the United Kingdom.
It was a very productive meeting, wrote British Sports Minister Lucy Frazer on Twitter.
"And I made the UK's position very clear: As long as Putin continues his barbaric war, Russia and Belarus must not be represented at the Olympic Games.
We will now issue a joint statement on this matter.

Previously, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky had protested against the participation of athletes from Russia and Belarus in international competitions during an international video conference of sports ministers and other high-ranking representatives.
"While Russia kills and terrorizes, representatives of this terrorist state have no place in sports and Olympic competitions," said Zelensky.
He published his speech on his Telegram channel.
Due to the Russian offensive war, ultimately even a neutral flag is soaked in blood and not bearable.
Ukraine threatens boycott
Ukraine also views
Belarus as a party to the war because the country provides military bases for Russian troop attacks.
Selenskyj called on officials to stand up for the protection of Olympic principles and prevent the admission of Russian athletes to the competitions.
The president also renewed his criticism of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), which has "unfortunately lost its honesty.
The conference was prompted by the IOC's announcement that it intends to allow athletes from Russia and Belarus to participate in international competitions under certain conditions.
Ukraine is also threatening to boycott if the IOC permits the athletes to compete.
Federal Ministry of the Interior also takes a position

The Federal Ministry of the Interior, responsible for sports, subsequently stated that it had also reaffirmed during the consultations its rejection of Russian and Belarusian athletes participating in Paris.
"In our view, there is no reason to invite Russian and Belarusian sports back to the competitions.
The Ukrainian athletes must continue to receive the unrestricted solidarity and support of the international sports community.
The IOC's efforts to reinstate Russian and Belarusian athletes is the wrong approach," a spokesperson for the Ministry of the Interior told dpa upon request.

Interior Minister Nancy Faeser (SPD) had already emphasized at the end of January: "Sports should be clear in its condemnation of the brutal war that Putin is waging against the Ukrainian civilian population.
Major sporting events do not take place in a vacuum.
Russia, on the other hand, insists that sports and politics must be kept separate.
Currently, Russia and Belarus are excluded from many international sports competitions.

However, the IOC is aiming for the return of athletes from both countries to the international sports stage under a neutral flag, provided they clearly commit to the Olympic Charter and do not actively support the war in Ukraine.
IOC President Thomas Bach recently stated that exclusion "due to a passport or place of birth" violates the prohibition of discrimination.

In the 1970s, Hans Modrow became the 1st Secretary of the District Leadership of the SED in Dresden.
As Prime Minister, he accompanied the end of the GDR.
Just four days after the fall of the Berlin Wall, on November 13, 1989, he was appointed Chairman of the Council of Ministers of the GDR for about 150 days.
In the People's Chamber elections on March 18, 1990, the SED/PDS lost power and Modrow lost his office a month later.
He was succeeded by CDU politician Lothar de Maizière as the last Prime Minister of the GDR until reunification.

Bartsch added:
"Until his old age, he was an important advisor in our party, whose wisdom will be missed.
"The entire peaceful process of the creation of German unity was precisely one of his special achievements.
This will remain his political legacy," Bartsch and Gysi wrote in their obituary.
It continues:

"His later work in the People's Chamber, the Bundestag, the European Parliament, and as honorary chairman of the PDS always consisted of representing that part of the former GDR population that was not wanted and whose interests were regularly violated.
After the reunification, Modrow served in the German Bundestag for the PDS from 1990 to 1994 and represented them in the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
According to a report by the German Press Agency (dpa), Modrow viewed the new state "quite critically.

The one-man entertainment device BATTLEZONE is equipped with a Vector or X/Y monitor.
This game illustrates the combat action from the perspective of a tank driver.
The battles take place in a wide valley, which is completely surrounded by mountains and volcanoes.
In the valley floor, there are rock pyramids and rock cubes, which provide the player with temporary protection, as they cannot be destroyed by enemy fire.
The opponent is represented by slow-moving tracked vehicles and fast super tanks, as well as agile missiles, which become increasingly difficult to hit during the extended course of the game.
Additionally, UFOs appear at periodic intervals.
These cannot attack the player's tank.
Conversely, the player can achieve a high score by hitting a UFO.
The BATTLEZONE device has five (5) different operating modes.
These are the attraction sequence, the game introduction sequence, the game sequence, the initials input for high scores, and the self-test sequence.
The latter mode represents a special sequence for checking the controls and computer function.
Gameplay
The game sequence is triggered when the START pressure switch is activated.
The LED switch remains illuminated and the game sounds become audible.
If the last player tank is eliminated by the enemy attacker, a game ends.
The game begins with slow-moving tanks that become visible on the screen.
The player can determine the position of the respective enemy tanks or missiles by paying attention to the displayed text in the upper left hint display angle of his cockpit.
A hint could read, for example:
ENEMY FROM THE RIGHT.
In addition, a point becomes visible on the far-reaching radar screen, accompanied by a sonar BLIP tone, representing the enemy position.
The upper, cone-shaped area on the radar screen represents the player's field of view on the screen below.
If the opponent is in this area, they can be easily targeted on the screen.
Furthermore, ENEMY IN FIRE RANGE is simultaneously displayed in the upper left hint display.
Occasionally, UFOs will appear on the screen, flying over the battlefield.
These are harmless aircraft that observe the battle and cannot eliminate either the enemy or the player's tank.
The flight position of the UFOs cannot be detected by radar.
The UFOs are meant to round off the battle and distract the player, as they usually appear simultaneously with enemy tanks or missiles.
UFOs can be eliminated by both the player's tank and the enemy's tank.
A shot down by the player earns them 5,000 points.
If an enemy is hit, the following points are achieved:
For a slow-moving tank 1,000 points, for a missile 2,000 points, and for a super tank 3,000 points.
A super tank moves and rotates twice as fast as the player's tank or an enemy's slow-moving tank.
Several options give the operator the opportunity to use 2, 3, 4, or even 5 tanks in a game.
Furthermore, after reaching predetermined point totals, a bonus tank can be released and the appearance of the missile can be varied for a more challenging game design.
Details and the exact switch positions of the game sequence selector switch for this setting option can be found in the illustration.
5. Initial input for top results
If a player exceeds the minimum score in the high score table, he or she can enter three (3) personal initials into the table at the end of the game.
The instructions for this are self-explanatory and can be displayed in four languages.
It should be noted that by triggering a self-test, pressing the RESET button on the Battlezone Analog Vector Generator PCB, or interrupting the power supply, the high score table will be deleted.
When resetting, the ten (10) highest scores with their initials are preserved and re-entered on the screen to challenge further players.
Any score over 100,000 is additionally marked with a tank symbol, followed by the player's initials.
If a player does not enter his or her initials within 60 seconds, dashes will be automatically entered by the computer.
After this, the device switches back to the attraction game sequence.
SETUP ARRANGEMENT
New Parts
The BATTLEZONE device has five (5) new components.
If you have previous experience with ATARI video devices, you should take note of these important differences.
The new parts are: A.
The control lever.
This is a redesign of the ATARI shift lever.
It has been reinforced with several additional ribs in the inner and outer housing part, making this assembly unit more stable and ensuring the proper function of the switch contacts.
Another modification is the rubber centering bellows, which, like a centering spring, always returns the control lever to the middle position.
The micro switches are now attached with self-locking nuts for easier replacement.
B. Two PC boards.
ATARI's X/Y game circuit has been expanded to two (2) interconnected boards.
These are the Analog Vector Generator and the Auxiliary Board.
With the help of this circuit technology, more lines are generated on the screen at a higher speed, resulting in a smooth and steady image.
C. The power supply.
Battlezone is equipped with a newly designed power supply.
It has a larger, more powerful transformer to cover the increased power supply provided by the expansion of the circuit.
D.
The device housing.
Due to the new design, it was now possible to install a new cash box with a larger coin capacity.
Furthermore, the device contains a console intended as a platform for smaller players to facilitate gameplay.
At the same time, this console ensures maximum device stability at the installation site.
These new components, as well as all other main assemblies of this device, are shown in Figure 1.
If one of these new parts is mentioned in the manual, you will find this symbol.
2. Device inspection
After removing the packaging, this new entertainment device is ready to play.
However, you should perform some checks to complete the quality control.
To be sure that the device has been delivered to you in a proper condition, the following checks should be made:
NOTE:
Do not yet connect the device to the 220 V network.
A. Check the outside of the case for damage.
B. Open the maintenance flap of the device and check the components inside the device as follows:
Check all cable harness connectors for correct and firm connection.
Connect any open or loose connectors.
NOTE:
Never forcefully make plug connections.
The plugs are equipped with a forced guidance system, ensuring a correct connection is made.
A 180-degree twisted plug connection will destroy the PCB.
Check the plug connections to the game PC board for correct and firm fit.
Note the production number of the device on the type plate on the back of the device.
Check whether the embossed production number matches those of the Battlezone Analog Vector Generator PC board, auxiliary PC board, controller/audio II PC board, and the TV monitor.
An illustration of the location of the production number is on the back cover of this manual.
This number should always be provided when you call your dealer for further service information.
Check all other main components such as the power supply, the control console, and the TV monitor for proper assembly.
Finally, the device must be supplied with mains voltage and switched on.
By looking through the player's viewing glass, check whether the radar screen is also located in the bright, orange-circled opening of the panel.
If the opening is not exactly centered, the panel, which is attached with adhesive tape to the housing, must be loosened and realigned.
Before the device is connected to the power supply, it must be ensured that the voltage selector plug on the power supply 1 (see Fig. 3) matches the local mains voltage.

ARE YOU HAVING PROBLEMS WITH YOUR SOFTWARE?
Below you will find a series of tips that can help you solve most problems related to current DirectX games.
Check the system configuration.
Please take the time to check if your system meets the requirements listed on the package.
With the help of the DirectX Diagnostic Tool, you can get an overview of your system if you are unsure whether your PC meets the requirements.
Please proceed as follows to call up the DirectX Diagnostic Tool:
Click on the "Start" button and select the "Run" option.
Enter "dxdiag" in the text field.
The user interface of the DirectX Diagnostic Tool will now be displayed.
Here you have access to all relevant system details, including information about the graphics and sound card.
Among other things, you can check whether graphics and sound are working correctly by clicking on the corresponding buttons to test DirectDraw, Direct3D, and DirectSound.
Note: If you do not have advanced computer skills, we would advise you against changing any of the options in the DirectX Diagnostic Tool.
Before starting the game.
It can happen that other programs take up the system resources that the game needs to run smoothly.
Not all of these programs make it obvious that they are active, and many are automatically started when the system boots up.
Such programs that are constantly active on your system are also called "background applications".
In some cases, they can be the reason why your program hangs or crashes.
Therefore, we recommend that you close such background applications before you start the game.
If antivirus or crash guard programs are running on your system, you should close or disable them before you start the game.
To do this, look for the program's icon in the Windows taskbar.
Right-click the icon and select the appropriate option ("Disable", "Close", or similar).
Once you have disabled the antivirus and crash guard programs, you should also close general background applications, as these can sometimes cause problems when you install or run a PC game.
You can read more about this in the section "How to close all unnecessary background applications".
Clean up the system.
Before you install software, it must be ensured that your hard drive is functioning optimally.
Therefore, you should make it a habit to "clean up" your PC at regular intervals.
The tools you need for this are included with Windows: Use ScanDisk, Defragmentation, and Disk Cleanup to ensure everything runs smoothly.
Then, there is a high chance that current games will run largely without problems on your PC.
A "clean" system also has the advantage of working much more efficiently, and thus other applications that you use will run faster and more stable.
Consult the Windows help files to learn about the ScanDisk or Error Checking, Defragmentation, and Disk Cleanup tools.
Using the Windows help
Click on the "Start" button and select the "Help" (or "Help and Support") option to access Windows Help.
2. Now click in the search field and enter the appropriate keyword, e. g.
"ScanDisk" (Win 98/ME), "Error checking" (Win 2000/XP), "Defragmentation" and "Disk Cleanup".
You will then receive instructions explaining how to use these tools.
The game crashes or hangs?
For games that use the latest version of DirectX, you should make sure you have the latest drivers for your graphics card.
This can often prevent a game from crashing or hanging.
First, you should try to download the latest drivers from the website of the graphics card manufacturer.
Below you will find the latest graphics card manufacturers:
How to terminate all unnecessary background applications
Important note:
After finishing the game, you should reactivate the background applications by restarting your PC.
This will automatically reactivate all the background applications that you have ended.
Windows 98/ME
Hold down the CTRL and ALT keys on your keyboard and then press DEL.
The "Close Application" window will now appear, listing all background applications currently running on your system.
2. To end a background application, click on the entry in the task list and then on the "End Task" button.
Note: Do not end the background applications Explorer and Systray, as these are needed for Windows to run.
All other background applications can be safely ended.
3. The window will now close and the task is ended.
Repeat the above steps to end all other background applications (except for "Explorer" and "Systray").
Windows 2000/XP Professional
Hold down the CTRL and ALT keys on your keyboard and then press DEL.
The Windows Security window will now appear.
2. Click on "Task Manager" to open the Windows Task Manager.
To end a background application, switch to the "Applications" tab, click on the corresponding entry in the task list, and then click on the "End Task" button.
Note: Depending on your system settings, pressing CTRL, ALT, and DEL may not display the Windows Security window, but the Windows Task Manager may appear immediately.
Windows XP Home
Hold down the CTRL and ALT keys on your keyboard and then press DEL.
The Windows Task Manager will now appear.
2. To end a background application, switch to the "Applications" tab, click on the corresponding entry in the task list, and then click on the "End Task" button.
Before you call the hotline.
If you wish to make a call, you should sit at your PC and have the following information ready (see section "Checking the System Configuration").
Please also prepare note-taking materials.
PC brand and model
Processor type
Operating system including version number (e. g.
Windows® 98; Windows® Me)
RAM (memory)
Information about graphics and sound card and drivers
INTRODUCTORY WORDS TO FAHRENHEIT

My desire to develop video games was sparked by the advent of 3D real-time technology, which suddenly opened up a host of new possibilities and appeared to me as a new means of expression, with which one could push the world to its limits.
It represented a way for me to explore new horizons.
I felt like a cinematic pioneer at the beginning of the 20th century:

On the one hand, I was struggling with the still immature technology, but on the other hand, I was aware that there was still everything to discover especially a new language that had to be both narrative and visual.
To be honest, the next ten years could not satisfy my hunger.

I had the vague feeling that video games were only exploiting a tiny part of their amazing creative possibilities because they were too focused on "action" and forgot a fundamental element of human experience: sensations.
Meanwhile, technology continued to make rapid progress.
Fahrenheit is my contribution to making video games a true means of conveying sensations.
Even though this could have happened in a completely different form, Fahrenheit's greatest merit is the fact that it raises real questions and offers concrete answers.

Fahrenheit is proof that you can create an interactive gaming experience that is not just based on fighting hideous monsters in dark corridors and shooting at boxes to get ammunition, but has much more demanding and profound content.
It is proof that you can both tell a story and offer game content without having to sacrifice the narrative or interactive elements.
I hope that both hardcore gamers and casual players will enjoy this new gaming experience.
If you are rather skeptical about video games, I hope that Fahrenheit will help to change your attitude in this respect.
May other developers also feel the desire to embark on this new creative path and enrich it with their own inspirations, talent and ambition.
Interactivity is still in its infancy and offers the chance to discover everything.

Over the past two years, Fahrenheit has filled a large part of our lives and has been an unforgettable interpersonal and intellectual adventure for the entire Quantic Dream team, in which we were constantly forced to question many of the principles previously considered inviolable.
I would be happy if Fahrenheit like books, movies and songs that have left a lasting impression on you also does not pass you by without leaving a trace.
David Cage
THE README FILE
On the Fahrenheit DVD-ROM, there is a ReadMe file that contains the license agreement and updated information about the game.
We recommend that you view this file so you can be aware of any changes that have been made after this manual was printed.
To view the file, double-click on it in the Fahrenheit directory on your hard drive (usually C:\Programs\Atari\Fahrenheit).
You can also access the ReadMe file by first clicking on the Start button on the Windows® taskbar and then sequentially selecting "Programs", "Atari", "Fahrenheit", and finally the ReadMe file.

The present SERVICE MANUAL is intended to familiarize you with the setup and maintenance of the QIX TV entertainment machine.
The game sequence is described on the front pages along with important notes for setup and maintenance.
General knowledge of microprocessors, TTL circuits, and TV monitors is assumed for the subsequent service tips.
Without knowledge in these areas, no attempt should be made to repair the electronic part of the device.
The manual concludes with the electrical plans.
We ask you to carefully observe the instructions of this manual to ensure satisfactory operation of the machine.
The information and illustrations contained in this SERVICE MANUAL correspond to the status at the time of printing.
CHANGES IN THE INTEREST OF TECHNICAL PROGRESS RESERVED, HOWEVER NO RETROFITTING OBLIGATION!
Please consider when setting up.
Transport damage
If visible transport damages are detected, they must be immediately reported, recorded on a transport document and confirmed by the deliverer (freight forwarder, federal railway, etc. ).
The manufacturer is not liable for transport damages!
Mains voltage
The device is set for the mains voltage indicated on the type plate.
For other mains voltages, the device transformer and the monitor transformer must be switched.
According to VDE regulation, the device is equipped with a protective conductor connection and is only intended for dry rooms.
Proper operation of the coin system requires the device to be set up level and plumb.
SERVICE TIPS
IMPORTANT!
If at any time an incomprehensible display appears on the monitor, please briefly turn off the machine (unplug it) and turn it back on.
If the device does not work properly afterwards, a repair is necessary.
Unplug before repair!
During monitoring and testing:
Do not touch parts carrying voltage!
Even when the device is switched off, the monitor can still carry dangerous voltage.
WARNING, HIGH VOLTAGE!
About 20,000 volts are present at the anode connection of the picture tube.
Only replace fuses with ones of the same values!
A blown fuse signals overload of a component.
If the fuse is replaced with a higher value one, serious damage can be caused.
Only replace components with original spare parts.
Never remove printed circuits/connections while the device is switched on.
SERVICE MANUAL QIX
Gameplay
By pressing the corresponding start button, the game starts for one or (with a minimum credit of 2) for 2 players.
The aim is to acquire as much area as possible without crossing the path of the rotating QIX and without hitting the wandering SPARX.
The game is set up so that a minimum prescribed area must be occupied before you can tackle the next area (round).
At the top of the screen, the time-controlled SPARX are indicated by red timing lines.
When the red lines meet, additional SPARX are released.
In case of an alarm, the SPARX turn into SUPER-SPARX and become more aggressive.
If, while you are trying to draw your territory, your marker gets into the death spiral, it will be destroyed, as you cannot cross your own path or go back.
If you hesitate and do not complete your area, a fuse is lit and your marker is destroyed.
Two speed settings are available.
At slow drawing speed, the points are doubled.
After opening the control panel, the 4 programming and test switches are accessible.
The QIX game is capable of self-testing, it provides data and demonstrates that circuits and controls are working flawlessly.
For more information, see "Service Program".
The volume can be adjusted on the volume control (VOLUME) on the Data/Sound PC board.
Programming and Test Switch:
SUB-TEST
Function: Switch to next text
Programming and Test Switch: TEST
Function: Advance to next program step (Display)
Programming and Test Switch: Up
Function:
Reset to factory settings (until the text turns green), enumeration by 1 step (when the text glows green)
Programming and Test Switch: Down
Function: Countdown by 1 step
There is the possibility to install a coin counter in the device.
A line to 412 V DC supply.
A line to connection J 15 13 on the ROM/IC board.
SERVICE PROGRAM
General.
For programming and testing, the 4 switches located in the device, the self-test button, and the LEDs on the Video-PC-Board are used.
Programming Display.
With this display, the language (English, French, Spanish, German) with which the address programming and the game operate is selected.
The languages can be set using the "Sub-Test" switch.
When the desired language green appears, press the "Test" switch to switch to the next program display.
Mission programming.
With this display, the difficulty factor for the game can be determined.
Furthermore, a "maximum number of credits" that may be present before the start of the game can be set.
The text to be changed is set by pressing the "Sub-Test" switch (appears green), the desired value for this line is programmed with the "Up" or "Down" switch.
By pressing the "Sub-Test" switch multiple times, the factory or basic setting can be reached, when the bottom line (RESET line) lights up green, press the "Up" switch.
The values are reset, the pointer (as the green appearing lines are called) jumps to the first line, further programming can be done.
"Test" always triggers the next program display.
"Back" [Reserve High Score Value x 10,000) is used to transfer the high score points to the next program display until "High hit rate so far".
This value determines the required number of points/hits a player needs in order for their own initials (names) and the hit points to be entered on the screen.
The "maximum number of credits" determines a coin acceptance limit for the device.
If the limit is exceeded, if a coin lock is present, the coin acceptance is blocked.
This can set a limited number of games for a player.
This value is from 1 99.
It should not be set so close to 99 that by inserting a coin the credits cannot become zero if more than 99 is added.
A free play mode can be selected by setting "maximum credits" to 0.
Further programming: "Number of games":
Number of marking characters per credit.
"Threshold": The percentage number that must be reached to switch to the next round
"Time limit": Release for additional
Sparx
"Difficulty": Difficulty level of the game process
"Startup sound": no sound at "0" during standby operation
At "1" sound even in stationary operation (animated sound)
"Table model": at "0" stationary device
at "1" table device
The credits per coin are set on the "coin slot programming" display.
High score program display ("highest hit rate so far").
The player's hit points and initials appear, including the next 10 scores.
The values are used to set the high score, which was selected on the previous display (set to "back").
By pressing the "Up" switch, the initials QIX are set as standard.
By pressing the "Test" switch, the next program display appears.
The "total evaluation".
By pressing the "Up" switch, it can be set to 0.
The following values are recorded:
Total credit:
The number of paid credits.
The total number is not set to 0.
When 1,000,000 is reached, the count starts over.
The total number can only appear as 0 if the battery or the W1 connector is removed, with the device turned off.
Left-side coins: Number of coins inserted in the left coin slot.
Middle coins: (not available)
Right-side coins: Number of coins inserted in the right coin slot.
Paid credits: Number of credits given for inserted (converted coins).
Granted credits: Number of credits given by the device.
Free games: Granted credits (Paid + granted credits per 100) Played minutes: Number of minutes played.
Won minutes: Number of minutes in extended or won game.
Free time: Won minutes/played minutes per 100.
Average game duration in sec. : Played minutes/paid + granted credits.
High Score (Hit Rate):
Number of times a player had a high enough hit rate to displace other players from the high score list.
By pressing the "Up" switch, the values are reset to 0.
By pressing the "Test" switch, the next program display appears.
Deposit slot programming/normal money setting.
With the help of this display, the installer can choose a standard coin setting or program another setting.
If a standard setting is provided, pressing the "Up" and "Down" switches selects the programming while the top digit glows green on the screen.
The size values change with the change of the digit.
When the correct setting is reached by pressing the "Test" switch, the setting is adopted.
If a setting is desired that does not correspond to the standard setting, the values can be adjusted by pressing the "Sub-Test" switch.
After a single press, the top setting number is set to 0, which means that a custom setting is possible.
Since the lower values are unchanged, the programmer can reduce his setting efforts by choosing a setting that is close to his desired values and only changing the values that are not suitable.
Once the setting has been made, any new size to be set can be selected by pressing the "Sub-Test" switch.
If pressed unintentionally, the standard setting appears.
The values can be increased or reduced with the "Up" and "Down" switch.
The process is completed by pressing the "Test" switch.
The coin multiplier ("coin unit") indicates how many coin units are given for each coin inserted through an assigned slot.
Coin units
"Credit" shows the number of required units before a credit is issued.
"Bonus" coin units show the required units before a bonus credit is issued.
"Min. Coin" is a value that accumulates credits until a set minimum amount of coins is reached.
In the standard setting, this value is not used "0".
CMOS MEMORY (memory)
FAILURE
If "Memory Failure Service Required" appears on the display, the CMOS RAM, in which all programming is stored, has failed.
All values stored in the RAM will be reset to factory default settings.
This condition likely indicates a battery failure or error.
TROUBLESHOOTING and SETTINGS
Start of the test method.
Press the "Sub-Test" button or the "Self-Test" button (SW 1 near the LED display).
All LEDs should light up and the hardware test can begin.
The tests and settings can be entered for each program display, by pressing the "Test" switch, the next program is displayed each time.
If a continuous test of the video board is desired, the self-test button must be pressed twice so that the video test begins in the auto-test mode.
In this program, the device will continuously perform the hardware test until it is switched off.
When the "Open Coin Door to Test" display appears, the program plug J 19, 1 2 must be plugged in.
With plug J 19 removed, the memory is protected and the CMOS RAM test video cannot be performed.
Hardware tests:
These tests are carried out as follows: O = off / I = on / X = test results.
The ROM checksum calculates the checksum of each video ROM and compares it with the checksum stored for this ROM.
If there is a difference, the device stops and the value of the ROM with the incorrect checksum appears on the LEDs.
If the checksum ROM is faulty, U 10 is displayed first.
If this test fails, the next ROM to be replaced is displayed on the LED display.
The E-PROM memory in a given game can be introduced as banks (series) of either 2716 or 2732 E-PROMs.
The E-PROM type for each series is selected by the decoding plug (26-00002-016 for 2716 or 26-00002-032 for 2732).
Communications RAM from the video board.

The Communications RAM test determines the functional reliability of the memory shared by two processors by storing predetermined series of numbers in the RAM and then checking if the storage was correct.
LED value: 00 0010
If the device stops with the above display, an error has been detected.
If the Communications RAM fails during the Video Board test, the error could be due to faulty wiring (RAM) or errors in the Data Board.
To locate the error, remove the Data Board from P 6 and repeat the test.
A failure means: Error in U 3, U 4 or associated circuits.
Video Board CMOS RAM
After values have been written into another part of the memory, the CMOS RAM is tested in the same way as the Communications RAM.
If the test is passed, all memory locations are reset to their previous value.
LED value: 00 0011
If the device stops with the above display, there is an error.
In this case, check U 85 and U 86 and the associated circuits or the decoding.
Check the video board color RAM by storing predetermined number sequences in the color RAM.
These number sequences are checked for accuracy when read back.
LED value: 00 0100
If this value is displayed, there is an error.
Check U 56, U 57, and associated multiplexers and decoders.
Video Board (Display RAM).
The display RAM is checked by writing a pattern on each side.
The results of these inscriptions are compared with the original pattern.
Any discrepancy causes the program to halt and the LEDs indicate the faulty RAM.
If a display RAM fails, identify the problem and replace the RAM.
If this error diagnosis does not indicate a RAM failure (00 0101 on LEDs), it is indicated that the next check is being started (Data Hardware).
The connection to the Data Processor must be present and it must be functional.

It's nice that you can adjust the screw to different sizes or lengths using the various parts, but once you've screwed everything together, you need pliers to take it all apart again.
Attaching the keys themselves is simply a game of patience, balance, and skill.
Ultimately, the screw broke off in the thread the third time I assembled it, rendering the entire thing useless.
Conclusion:
If at all, then only for once all necessary keys and then never again, but at the price, you can also buy a cheaper alternative.
Does not quite match the specified dimensions

So-so

Chic dress

Stay away.
It doesn't get any worse.
I really and seriously did not expect such junk to be sold these days.
The drive is operated on a high-end Asus ROG Strix Scar II gaming laptop.
It is assumed that the USB ports provide sufficient power.
Nevertheless, trouble-free operation of this drive is not possible.
DVDs usually work, Blu-rays are recognized at best unreliably.
The discs have to be inserted several times, after which it makes grinding noises as you haven't heard since the 90s from old PCs and the very first CD-ROM drives.
After minutes, you can either restart the computer because it won't get any better or the disc is finally recognized.
But then you must not press pause or jump to a chapter or change the language during the film or do anything at all.
This immediately leads to an irreparable freeze.
In addition, of course, no Blu-ray software is included.
If you buy PowerDVD or similar for an additional fee, the price of this drive doubles.
It does what it's supposed to do, but it's not pretty.
First and foremost, I want to point out that the two USB ports are somewhat deceptive, as only the port that points upwards is a USB port.
The other plug is only for charging various devices and is therefore relatively useless.
I didn't know this when I bought it, which is why I was a bit disappointed.
I actually needed a second port and if I had only needed a simple extension, I certainly wouldn't have bought this misshapen lump with golden plugs.
But apart from the aesthetics and my misjudgment, the extension does its job very reliably.
And due to the weight of the plug, the inserted USB stick doesn't just dangle around like it would with a normal extension cord.
So it's not a complete waste of money, but my enthusiasm is somewhat limited :-).
Small but powerful!
I bought this product so that I could have an audio output on my iPad (Pro) and connect a display.
With IOS 12, you can now also transfer data back and forth.
This works very well.
Furthermore, the audio output was as expected.
Other adapters, which I had to send back, unfortunately could not do this.

Simultaneous charging is not a problem.
Sound is delivered via HDMI.
What else do I use my PlayStation for :P
There was a small adapter included which can be attached to the tablet.

It doesn't fit with my case and the adapter.
Well, it holds securely and has contact anyway.
All in all, a bit expensive but justified by the full range of functions.
In addition, it's very small and sturdily made from a piece of aluminum.
The price-performance ratio is right.

Very good

Surprisingly good
Since there are hardly any reviews to read here, I was initially very skeptical.
However, since I am going to a festival this year and would like to sleep in the car, I ordered it on good luck.
The delivery included the mattress and a car air pump.
About the mattress:
I test laid it in the car (Citroen Berlingo).
I noticed that there is some mold on one side.
I wiped it off and hope that it does not reappear.
A lying test was carried out in the inflated state.
It is comfortable to lie on and is perfect for the festival.
Of course, this mattress cannot replace your own bed, but for days at the event, it is pure luxury.
The mattress fits wonderfully into my car.
We removed the seats in the back beforehand.
So it fits perfectly.
The air pump:
The air pump has different adapters.
The mattress requires two different adapters, which can also be found on the pump.
The pump is plugged into the car's cigarette lighter.
However, the plug was defective (something at the soldering point).
Since my boyfriend is handy, he was able to repair it and once reassembled, the pump worked excellently and inflated the mattress in no time.
Overall, I am very excited about the mattress.
I am looking forward to the stress test at the festival.
I hope that it does not lose air and lasts a long time.
Also, that the mold does not reappear.
After the test, I can definitely recommend it.
If I should have other experiences, I will revise the review accordingly (if possible).
Definitely not worth more than 10€. ..

For the fast shipping.

. and yet I am sending it back.

Elegant case with limitations
For the slippery Samsung Galaxy S10+, one should definitely get a case.
I have recently liked cases in which you can also insert a credit card.
This case offers that.
If you insert cards into all 3 compartments, it becomes too much, then the lid stands up a bit.
One is enough for me.
The leather case seems sturdy and well made.
It looks elegant.
The phone is embedded all around, unlike many other cases, with only cutouts at the connections.
Otherwise, you can easily operate the on-off switch and volume control on the sides through the case.
The disadvantage is that it is not possible to charge the phone on some QI chargers due to the thickness of the case.
Even on the QI charging station made of leather from TORRO, it doesn't work.
Accessories like the Galaxy Buds can therefore only be charged when the case is off.
Otherwise, it's really chic and well made!

A truly successful and beautiful product with a very good price-performance ratio.

Overall a good purchase.
